question.Q: Do you sweat a lot on most days?
Are you overweight according to the body mass index chart
See your doctor. If you are overweight, even routine physical activity can cause sweating.

Do you have two or more Of the following symptoms?
• Unexplained weight loss
• Increased appetite
• Weakness or trembling
• Bulging eyes
• Rapid heartbeat
See your doctor. You could have an overactive thyroid gland.
Does the sweating occur mainly at night, even though you are not using heavy blankets?
Do you have a persistent cough, or have you lost weight?
See a doctor immediately. You may have a serious chronic infection such as TUBERCULOSIS or HIV or you could have a type of cancer such as HODGKIN'S DISEASE.
Is your temperature 100 ℉ (37.8 ℃ ) or higher?
Sweating is the normal response to fever. Would you like to review symptoms commonly associated with Fever?
Sweating is the normal response to fever
Are you a woman over 40?
Have your periods become irregular?
Increased perspiration is common in women who are approaching menopause.
Does the sweating occur only during your periods?
It is normal for many women to perspire more than usual during their period.
Did you begin sweating after taking large doses of aspirin or drinking alcohol?
See your doctor if aspirin seems to be the cause. Alcohol can increase perspiration.
Are you wearing clothes made of a synthetic fiber such as nylon?
Most synthetic fibers increase perspiration because they do not absorb moisture or allow the skin to breathe. Wear clothes made of absorbent natural fibers such as cotton or wool if possible.
Is the sweating problem just with your feet?

Many people have sweaty feet. Avoid wearing socks or shoes made of synthetic materials, which can increase perspiration. Wash and dry your feet once or twice a day, and sprinkle a foot powder on your feet.
Does the sweating occur only when you are nervous or excited?
Increased perspiration is common during times of emotional stress.
Are you a teenager?
It is normal to sweat more, especially to have sweaty palms, during adolescence.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chat or if you are concerned about the excessive sweating.
Did you begin sweating after taking large doses of aspirin or drinking alcohol?
